page.title: 09Whalley Abbey 1985
page.content: Many ordinary and ordained Christians of varying denominations spend time in silent{retreat}at the Abbey.A{retreat}is a time when people come away from their ordinary lives to a quiet place to{reflect}and pray for the needs of the world, to pray for themselves and rededicate their lives to{God.} Its primary use is as a{training/} {conference}centre for the{Anglican} church,and as such runs a variety of faith building courses and also others to meet the{needs}of modern society, which include team building courses for{young people}in industry and adjustment courses for the{unemployed. It is also used{by industry}to train potential managers. Whalley Abbey is ideal for holidays and family celebrations.The{friendly, {peaceful atmosphere}attracts all.
